children.name: when sb is killed to stop them from suffering
mercy killing x
children.definition: mercy killing when sb who is very ill is killed in a painless way in order to stop them suffering any longer: cái chết ko đau đớn
examples: some doctors carry out mercy killings by giving large quantities of pain-killing drugs.

children.name: euthanasia x
children.definition: euthanasia when sb who is very old or very ill is killed in a painless way in order to stop them suffering any longer - use this to talk about this practice ingeneral: cái chết không đau đớn
examples: in the netherlands euthanasia has already been legalized.
most doctors are opposed to euthanasia on ethical grounds.
although some people campaign for the right to euthanasia, it is still illegal in most countries.

children.name: suicide pact x
children.definition: suicide pactan agreementbetween two or more people to kill themselves together at the same time : thề chết chung
examples: the leader of the religious sect and thirty of his followers killed themselves in a suicide pact last year.

children.name: suicide b2
children.definition: suicide when b deliberately kills himself or herself:tự sát
examples: police are treating the man’s death as suicide.
there is grave concern about the number of teenage suicides recorded last year.
commit suicide
barry threatened to commit suicide if she refused to marry him.
suicide attempt
stephen required hospital treatment after his suicide attempt.
suicidal[adj] sb who is suicidal is likely to kill themselves because they are extremely unhappy: muốn tự tử
the thought of having to stay in the house all day made me feel almost suicidal.
suicidal tendenciesbehaviour that shows you may try to kill yourself
had the prisoner previously displayed suicidal tendencies?

children.name: right-to-die x
children.definition: right-to-die if you believe ina person's right-to-die, you support the belief that a person should be allowed to die naturally rather than being kept alive by medical methods when they are unlikely to get well again: quyền được chết

children.name: kill yourself a2
children.definition: kill yourself
examples: he killed himself by jumping under a train.
she tried to kill herself when news of the scandal leaked out.
you’ll kill yourself if you go on drinking like that.

children.name: take your own life x
children.definition: take your own life formal to kill yourself:
examples: many religions consider that it is a sin to take your own life.
desperately frustrated and alone, she could see no way out except to take her own life.

children.name: end it all x
children.definition: end it all informal usually humorous if you want to end it all, you want to kill yourself because you are extremely unhappy, lonely etc - used especially in stories:
examples: sometimes i feel so low i just feel like ending it all.
and if this doesn't work, i'm just going to end it all.

children.name: hara-kiri x
children.definition: hara-kiri (in japan, especially in the past)a formal way of killing yourselfby cutting open your stomach with a sword : lối mổ bụng tự sát của nhật bản

children.name: fatal b2
children.definition: fatal a fatal accident, illness, or injury is one that causes death:chết người
examples: he suffered a fatal injury to the neck.
a fatal heart attack
meyer’s car was involved in a fatal accident on the freeway.
fatal to
a sudden shock could be fatal to anyone with a weak heart.
fatally[adv]
fatally injured/wounded
the bank manager was fatally wounded during the robbery.
his father had been fatally injured in an explosion in the mine where he worked.

children.name: lethal c2
children.definition: lethal sth that is lethal can cause death - use this especially aboutweaponsorsubstances: gây chết người
examples: the poison produced by the frog’s skin is so lethal that it can paralyze a bird or a monkey immediately.
a lethal cocktail of pollutants is being poured into scotland’s coastal waters, according to greenpeace.
a 59-year-old man was executed by lethalinjection(= by having a poisonous substance put into his body) this morning.
informalthat combination of tiredness and alcohol is lethal (= has a very bad effect) .
lethal weapon
almost any sharp or pointed object can potentially be a lethal weapon.
lethal to
most pesticides are lethal to earthworms on or near the surface.

children.name: deadly b2
children.definition: deadly sth such as adiseaseorpoisonthat is deadly can cause death:gây chết người
examples: in the first world war pneumonia was as deadly as bullets and shells.
some mushrooms are edible while others, which look almost identical, contain deadly poisons.

children.name: killer x
children.definition: killer a killer disease or thing could kill or has killed a lot of people - used especially in newspapers:
examples: a swarm of killer bees has attacked 70 children in a village in northern mexico.
killer floods and hurricanes in asia have destroyed whole towns.

children.name: mortal x
children.definition: mortal a mortal injury, wound, or disease is one that causes death - used especially in literature: tử
examples: he killed leonardo and received a mortal wound himself.
he gathered all his strength to deliver his opponent the final mortal blow.
men engaged in mortalcombat(= fighting until one of them dies)
figurativenew computing technology dealt a mortalblowto the power of the old printing unions.
mortally[adv]
mortally wounded/ill
wolfe and his opponent montcalm were both mortally wounded in the battle.

children.name: kill a2
children.definition: kill/kɪl/  to make sb die, especially deliberately or violently:
examples: he claims that he didn’t mean to kill his wife.
the police believe the man may kill again.
what the hell were you doing! you could have killed me!
official sources say that 20 people were killed in last night’s air raids.
my sixteen-year-old son louis was killed by a drunk driver two years ago.
thousands of the rebels were killed in a gun battle with government troops.
the gunman killed 22 people and wounded 15, before turning his gun on himself.

children.name: do away with x
children.definition: do away with sb  to kill sb, especially because they are a threat or their death would be convenient:
examples: perhaps his wife had taken the opportunity to do away with her rival.

children.name: bump off x
children.definition: bump sb off  to kill someone - often used humorously:
examples: he kept marrying rich women and then bumping them off.
have sb bumped offarrange for someone to be killed
his uncle decided to have him bumped off.

children.name: to kill sb in a particular way
smother x
children.definition: smother to kill someone by covering their face so that they cannot breathe : làm ngột ngạt, làm ngạt thở; bóp chết
examples: they threatened to smother the animals with plastic bags.

children.name: strangle x
children.definition: strangle siết cổ chết; bóp nghẹt
examples: to kill someone by pressing their throat so that they cannot breathe
she had been strangled with her own scarf and her body dumped in the woods.
strangler[ c ]người bóp cổ giết ai
a person who kills people by pressing their throats so that they cannot breathe
the newspapers dubbed him 'the boston strangler'.

children.name: beat sb to death c2
children.definition: beat/kick/stab etc somebody to death/ˌbiːt somebody tə ˈdeθ/  to kill someone by beating them, kicking them, or attacking them with a knife: đánh đập/ đá/ đâm ai đến chết
examples: the court heard how the man was beaten to death by racist thugs.
a social worker was found stabbed to death in her office last night.
smith had apparently been kicked to death.

children.name: poison b2
children.definition: poison to kill a person or animal or to make them very ill by giving them poison : đánh thuốc độc
examples: four members of the family had been poisoned, but not fatally.
poisonernoun[ c ] kẻ giết người bằng thuốc độc
a person who has killed or harmed someone using poison

children.name: drown b2
children.definition: drown/draʊn/  to kill sb by holding their face under water for a long time:nhấn chìm
examples: he accused his brother of trying to drown him.

children.name: kill a2
children.definition: kill
examples: is it morally acceptable to kill animals for food?
you shouldn’t really kill spiders, even if you’re frightened of them.
they were so hungry they killed the rest of their livestock that winter.

children.name: destroy x
children.definition: destroy to kill an animal in a painless way, especially using drugs, because it is dangerous or in pain:
examples: the animal disease authority decided to destroy the cattle that were infected with the disease.
have sth destroyed
the court ordered the owner of the rottweilers to have the dogs destroyed.

children.name: put down x
children.definition: put down/ put to sleep  to kill an animal, especially a pet, in a painless way, because it is very old or very ill, or is not wanted:
examples: when our old cat became very sick we had to ask the vet to put her down.
she rescued sandy from the animal shelter the day before he was due to be put to sleep.
have sth put down/put to sleep
a blind dog is no use to a shepherd. i’m afraid i’m going to have to have him put down.

children.name: cull x
children.definition: cull to kill a large number of animals, for example in order to stop a disease spreading or to keep the numbers of a particular animal population down:
examples: over two million sheep have been culled to prevent the spread of foot and mouth disease.
the plan to cull large numbers of baby seals has angered environmental groups.
cull[c]
the cull is thought to have cost many farmers their livelihoods.
a seal cull
the annual red deer cull

children.name: kill a2
children.definition: kill to cause sb’s death - use this especially aboutaccidents, diseases, or substances:giết chết
examples: a car drove onto the pavement, killing three of mrs maguire’s children.
the explosion killed 32 people.
the disease has already killed more than 2000 in latin america.
many people do not realize that these drugs are dangerous and can kill.
be killed in a crash/accident etc
james dean was killed in a car crash in 1955.

children.name: cause death b1
children.definition: cause death to make sb die:
examples: rhubarb leaves, either raw or cooked, can cause violent stomach pains or even death.
research is being done into the virus that caused the death of 15,000 seals last summer.
the injuries sustained by the victim were not sufficient to have caused death in a healthy person.
cause of death[np]
the cause of death was a broken neck.

children.name: kill off x
children.definition: kill off to cause the death of a group of plants or animals:
examples: kill off sth/kill sth off
it was the cold winter of 1992 that finally killed off the last of the roses.
if you plant your seedlings out too soon, a late frost might kill them off.

children.name: destroy b1
children.definition: destroy to kill things, especially plants and trees, so that they can never start to grow again:
examples: a vast amount of the amazonian rainforest is being destroyed every day.
milk is heat treated for a few seconds to destroy bacteria.
destruction[u]
destroy of
we should be discouraging the unnecessary destruction of any wild species.

children.name: be a killer x
children.definition: be a killer if an illness is a killer, it kills a lot of people, especially because there is no cure:
examples: in those days measles was a major killer.
diphtheria is still a killer in many developing countries.

children.name: wipe out c2
children.definition: wipe out to kill a complete group or race of people, or all of a type of animal or plant, so that it no longer exists: quét sạch
examples: wipe out sb/sth
archaeologists think that massive floods could have wiped out the dinosaurs.
wipe somebody/something out
the fur trade has wiped leopards out in some areas.

children.name: decimate x
children.definition: decimate to kill large numbers of the people, animals, or plants in a particular place: tàn sát, sát hại, giết hại
examples: cambodia’s 21-year war decimated the wildlife population.
his prize herd of cows has been decimated by an unknown disease.
decimation[u]
decimate of
after the decimation of the rainforests, life on earth will be very different.
